New Records: Edwards’ 8 consecutive games scoring at least 20 points, a feat last achieved by Kevin Garnett in 2004
Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards led the Timberwolves to a 135-119 victory over the Chicago Bulls
Post-Match Reflections: Edwards’ remarkable start has energized the Timberwolves and significantly bolstered their standing in the Western Conference

The Minnesota Timberwolves’ resurgence, fueled by Anthony Edwards' standout performances, recalls the dominant play of Kevin Garnett during his years with the franchise, sparking hopes for another potential deep playoff run
Miscellaneous Highlights: Edwards added eight rebounds, six assists, and a block
His three-point shooting has also seen a marked improvement, climbing from 35.7% last season to 46.2% this season
Edwards is averaging a career-best 28.0 points, 5.9 rebounds, and 3.4 assists per game while shooting 48.2% from the field
